items.title: Israeli neurotech firm Brain.space nets $14.5m series A
items.summary:
- Brain.space raised US$11 million in a Series A funding round led by Toyota Ventures.
- The company received an additional US$3.5 million non-dilutive grant from the Israel Innovation Authority.
- Total funding amounts to over US$14 million.
- Brain.space focuses on technology that quantifies cognitive and emotional states in real time.
- Funding will enhance data collection infrastructure, improve models, and accelerate commercialization efforts.

items.title: US digital asset firm Utila raises $18m series A
items.summary:
- Utila has raised US$18 million in a Series A funding round led by Nyca Partners.
- This funding increases the total amount raised by Utila to US$30 million since its launch in March 2024.
- The company offers infrastructure for payment providers and financial institutions, including multi-party computation (MPC) wallets.
- Utila has processed US$35 billion in transactions over the past 18 months and aims to expand its global presence and R&D with the new funding.

items.title: These funds have not invested in Indonesia in the past year
items.summary:
- Some funds have ceased investing in Indonesia in the past year, despite having invested in the previous two years.
- Possible reasons include waiting for better market conditions, shifting focus, or the market not being a priority.
- The importance of timing outreach to investors is emphasized.
- The article notes that it's part of a database that welcomes user input for accuracy.

items.title: Spanish sports app Playtomic raises funding, valued at $273m
items.summary:
- Spanish sports app Playtomic successfully raised funding, resulting in a valuation of $273 million.
- The new funding is part of a broader investment trend in sports technology apps.
- The app is designed to enhance user experience in sports activities and bookings.

items.title: Foxconn expects AI server revenue to surpass iPhone sales
items.summary:
- Foxconn predicts its server revenue will exceed iPhone revenue within two years, driven by strong demand for AI servers.
- Chairman Young Liu indicated this shift may occur as soon as this year.
- Liu estimates AI server revenue could reach T$1 trillion (US$30.29 billion) by 2025, accounting for over half of total server revenue.
- Revenue from cloud and networking products is expected to match that of iPhones in the same timeframe.

items.title: SG healthtech startup Kyberlife raises $3m to grow in SEA
items.summary:
- SG healthtech startup Kyberlife has raised $3 million to expand operations in Southeast Asia.
- The funding will be used to enhance technology and increase regional reach.
- This move comes as part of a growing trend of healthtech companies seeking to innovate in the healthcare sector in SEA.

items.title: Kuaishou’s Kling AI adds DeepSeek for creative video tools
items.summary:
- Kuaishou has introduced a new feature called DeepSeek to its Kling AI for enhancing creative video tools.
- DeepSeek aims to optimize video content creation by providing advanced editing and analysis capabilities.
- This development positions Kuaishou competitively within the expanding landscape of AI-powered video solutions.

items.title: Jollibee’s café-buying spree brews a showdown with startups
items.author: Miguel Cordon
items.summary:
- Jollibee Foods Corporation (JFC), valued at US$4.5 billion, is expanding into the café industry.
- Recently opened Tiong Bahru Bakery in Metro Manila, marking its first location outside Singapore.
- Acquired majority stake in South Korea's Compose Coffee for US$238 million, enhancing their coffee portfolio.
- The coffee segment including Compose Coffee and Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf has seen significant growth, contributing to a 17.7% net income increase in 2024.

items.title: EY, Nvidia launch AI platform to boost business efficiency
items.summary:
- EY launched the EY.ai Agentic Platform in partnership with Nvidia.
- The platform incorporates Nvidia’s AI tools, including Nvidia AI Enterprise and AI-Q Blueprint, to enhance operational efficiency.
- It features frameworks like responsible AI using Nvidia NeMo Guardrails and agent creation frameworks based on Nvidia Blueprints.
- Designed for deployment in various environments: client clouds, on-premises systems, and edge computing.

items.title: Mistral AI partners with Singapore’s Defense Ministry
items.summary:
- Singapore’s Ministry of Defence collaborates with Mistral AI to enhance decision-making in the Armed Forces.
- Focus on developing generative AI models, including a tailored mixture-of-experts model.
- The partnership aims to improve information retrieval and AI-driven decision support systems in secure environments.

items.title: Singapore explores AI-driven defense autonomy with Anduril
items.summary:
- Singapore's Defence Science and Technology Agency (DSTA) partners with Anduril Industries and the Republic of Singapore Air Force (RSAF) to enhance mission autonomy.
- The collaboration will utilize Anduril's Lattice for Mission Autonomy software to develop autonomous behaviors for improved decision-making in the field.
- Simulation demonstrations are planned for testing these behaviors over the next year.
- This partnership represents Anduril's first international collaboration for its mission autonomy platform.

items.title: Bukalapak’s financial health in 7 charts
items.summary:
- Bukalapak became Indonesia’s first unicorn listed on the stock exchange in 2021.
- The article presents interactive charts showing Bukalapak's performance metrics.
- Charts are based on earnings releases, available [here](https://about.bukalapak.com/en/investor-relations/#quarterly-results).
- Some previous charts are no longer updated due to lack of data from Bukalapak.
- Content is behind a paywall, requiring a subscription for access.

items.title: Tencent’s Q4 profit up 90% – thanks to its AI, gaming
items.summary:
- Tencent Holdings reports a 90% increase in Q4 profit, reaching 51.3 billion yuan (approximately US$7.1 billion).
- Q4 revenue rose by 11% to 172.4 billion yuan (around US$23.85 billion), exceeding estimates.
- For the full year, profit increased by 68% to 194 billion yuan (around US$26.8 billion), with revenue climbing 8% to 660.2 billion yuan (around US$91.3 billion).
- Financial gains attributed to improved AI-powered advertising and consistent growth in gaming titles.
- Shares closed down 0.2% to HK$540 prior to the earnings release.

items.title: Nvidia unveils ‘first open foundation model for humanoid robots’
items.author: Jim Fan
items.summary:
- Nvidia introduced the GR00T N1, claimed to be the world’s first open foundation model for humanoid robots.
- The model utilizes a neural network for translating visual input into motor actions and has a Diffusion Transformer operating at 120 Hz.
- It has been trained using humanoid teleoperation data, large-scale simulations, and synthetic trajectories.
- Reports indicate a 30% improvement in manipulation tasks applicable to household and industrial environments.
- GR00T N1 is capable of cross-embodiment, demonstrated through adaptation to the HuggingFace LeRobot SO100 robot arm.
- The initiative includes open-sourcing over 300,000 simulated trajectories for research in robotics.

items.title: RedDoorz is getting an upgrade
items.summary:
- RedDoorz achieved its first profitable year in 2024, focusing on core markets.
- The company withdrew from Singapore and Vietnam to concentrate on Indonesia and the Philippines.
- Plans to diversify offerings with upscale choices while delaying IPO until market conditions improve.

items.title: Indonesia’s TikTok Shop reports 40% sales increase in Ramadan
items.author: Melissa Siska Juminto
items.summary:
- TikTok Shop reported a 40% sales increase during Ramadan 2025 compared to the previous year.
- The update was shared by Melissa Siska Juminto, President Director of Tokopedia and TikTok E-Commerce, at an event in Jakarta on Mar. 17, 2025.
- There was a significant increase in local sellers and TikTok users uploaded 72 million short videos in the first week of Ramadan, attributed to increased seller activity and promotional efforts.

items.title: Crypto.com hits $1.5b revenue as crypto token debate grows
items.summary:
- Crypto.com reported a revenue of $1.5 billion.
- The growth comes amid ongoing debates regarding cryptocurrency tokens.
- The article discusses the implications of this revenue surge in relation to the crypto market.

items.title: GM, Nvidia partner to advance AI in autonomous vehicles
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- GM and Nvidia have announced a partnership to enhance AI technologies in autonomous vehicles.
- The collaboration aims to leverage Nvidia's AI computing capabilities with GM's automotive expertise.
- This partnership signifies a significant move towards more advanced autonomous driving solutions in the industry.

items.title: These are the most active investors in Indonesia’s startups
Ubisoft’s ‘Assassin’s Creed Shadows’ seeks to revive finances
items.summary:
- Ubisoft is launching ‘Assassin’s Creed Shadows’ as a strategic move to revive its financial health.
- This new installment aims to reinvigorate interest in the franchise amid declining sales.
- The company hopes to leverage the popularity of the series to boost its overall financial performance.

items.title: Tencent Cloud to invest $650m in Saudi, Indonesia data centers
items.author: Dowson Tong
items.summary:
- Tencent Cloud plans to invest over $650 million to expand its infrastructure in the Middle East and Southeast Asia.
- The investment includes over $150 million for a data center in Saudi Arabia and $500 million for a third data center in Indonesia.
- Tencent Cloud serves over 10,000 clients in more than 80 countries and has partnered with over 40 Fortune 500 companies for digital transformation.

items.title: Yum Brands, Nvidia debut AI tech for Taco Bell, Pizza Hut orders
items.summary:
- Yum Brands and Nvidia introduced AI technology to optimize online ordering at Taco Bell and Pizza Hut.
- The AI aims to enhance customer experience and improve order accuracy.
- This collaboration highlights the growing trend of incorporating AI in the fast-food industry to streamline operations.

items.title: Chinese automaker Neta Auto denies rumors of disbanding R&D team
items.summary:
- Neta Auto has officially denied rumors about disbanding its R&D team.
- The rumors suggested potential cuts in response to economic challenges facing the automotive industry.
- Neta Auto emphasized its commitment to innovation and development in electric vehicles.

items.title: Nio’s Firefly to launch $21K EV with swappable batteries April 19
items.summary:
- Firefly, a brand under Nio, will launch its first model on April 19, with immediate deliveries.
- The vehicle will be priced at approximately $21,000 and positioned as a premium small vehicle.
- Firefly plans to establish pilot operation stations in key cities later this year.
- The new vehicles will use Nio’s fifth-generation battery swap network, adhering to existing battery specifications.

items.title: SG competition watchdog says no Grab-GoTo merger notice received
items.summary:
- The Singapore Competition and Consumer Commission (CCCS) has not received any merger notice regarding the Grab and GoTo companies.
- This comes amid scrutiny over potential anti-competitive practices in the Southeast Asian market.
- Companies are required to notify the CCCS of any merger activities that may impact competition in the market.

items.title: Allianz in talks with Jio Financial for India insurance re-entry
items.summary:
- Allianz is in discussions with Jio Financial to re-enter the Indian insurance market.
- This potential partnership could enhance Jio Financial's offerings in the insurance sector.
- Allianz aims to leverage Jio’s extensive customer base to expand its reach in India.

items.title: Abu Dhabi, Microsoft, G42 partner for AI-powered cloud
items.summary:
- Abu Dhabi partners with Microsoft and G42 to create a sovereign cloud system aimed at enhancing government services.
- The cloud is designed to manage over 11 million digital interactions daily.
- This initiative is part of Abu Dhabi’s ambition to become the world’s first fully AI-native government by 2027.
- The emirate plans to invest 13 billion dirham (approximately US$3.5 billion) in digital infrastructure under the Abu Dhabi Government Digital Strategy 2025-2027.

items.title: CrowdStrike, Nvidia team up to boost AI threat detection
items.summary:
- CrowdStrike announced AI-driven cybersecurity developments in collaboration with Nvidia.
- The updates utilize NVIDIA’s AI software to improve the efficiency and accuracy of CrowdStrike’s security operations.
- The integration of Nvidia’s NIM microservices into CrowdStrike’s Charlotte AI Detection Triage enhances automated detection processes to operate twice as fast with 50% fewer compute resources.
- The initiative aims to reduce alert fatigue and enhance the efficiency of security operations centers (SOCs).

items.title: Indian fintech startup QueueBuster expands into MENA
items.summary:
- Indian fintech startup QueueBuster has announced its expansion into the MENA region.
- The move is part of a strategic plan to grow its presence in international markets.
- QueueBuster aims to enhance customer engagement and streamline checkout processes for businesses in MENA.

items.title: Xiaomi to expand EV factory in Beijing
items.summary:
- Xiaomi is expanding its second EV factory in Beijing due to increased sales targets of 350,000 units for this year.
- The factory, located in the Yizhuang district, was built on a 53-hectare site purchased for approximately US$116 million.
- Production is expected to begin in mid-2025, with the expansion including an additional adjacent 52-hectare plot.

items.title: SoftBank scores big as Google buys Wiz for $32b
items.summary:
- SoftBank's investment in Israeli cybersecurity firm Wiz has led to a significant return after Google acquired Wiz for US$32 billion.
- SoftBank invested in Wiz in August 2024, tripling its initial investment in eight months.
- Wiz, founded in 2020, serves nearly 45% of Fortune 100 companies and raised US$1 billion in May 2024 at a valuation over US$12 billion.
- The company projected an annual revenue rate of US$500 million by July, with expectations to reach US$1 billion by 2025.
- Google’s acquisition is the largest tech deal in Israel’s history, highlighting the booming interest in cybersecurity.

items.title: OpenAI, Google seek flexibility in South Korea’s AI law
items.author: Sandy Kunvatanagarn, Alice Hunt Friend, Eunice Huang
items.summary:
- Representatives from OpenAI and Google requested flexibility in South Korea's AI Basic Act.
- The meeting involved representatives Sandy Kunvatanagarn (OpenAI) and Alice Hunt Friend, Eunice Huang (Google), alongside discussions led by Jared Ragland from BSA.
- The AI Basic Act will take effect in January 2026, following its passage in December 2024.
- This law is the second global AI law after the EU’s framework.
- The South Korean Ministry of ICT is currently drafting enforcement ordinances and clarifying operator liability and definitions of high-impact AI applications.

items.title: Wiz founders may earn $3.2b each in Alphabet deal
items.author: Assaf Rappaport, Ami Luttwak, Yinon Costica, Roy Reznik
items.summary:
- Alphabet to acquire cybersecurity firm Wiz for US$32 billion.
- Each of the four founders may receive about US$3.2 billion after taxes.
- Significant contribution expected to Israeli tax revenues.
- The acquisition marks Alphabet's largest to date, surpassing previous offers.

items.title: Hyundai Mobis to mass-produce chips for EVs, smart lamps
items.summary:
- Hyundai Mobis plans to mass-produce in-vehicle chips for electrification and lamp systems.
- Increased demand for vehicle chips driven by electric vehicles (EVs) and autonomous driving technology.
- The company will focus on chips for EV power control and in-vehicle lamp operation.
- Modern vehicles may require around 3,000 semiconductor chips according to Hyundai Mobis.

items.title: LG unveils South Korea’s first open-source AI model Exaone Deep
items.summary:
[LG has introduced Exaone Deep, the first open-source AI model in South Korea.]
[This model is designed to enhance AI development and research within the region.]
[Exaone Deep aims to provide flexible and accessible AI tools for developers and researchers.]

items.title: Bain Capital-backed Bridge Data Centres secures $2.8b loan deal
items.summary:
- Bridge Data Centres has secured a US$2.8 billion loan to support operations in Malaysia.
- This is the company’s largest bank financing arrangement to date.
- The five-year syndicated loan will refinance existing facilities and fund expansion.
- Bridge Data Centres is part of Wintrix, acquired by Bain Capital for US$3.2 billion in 2023.

items.title: Israel’s top-funded tech companies in the last decade
items.summary:
- Israel is recognized as a "startup nation" with rapid growth in its high-tech sector since the early 2000s.
- The article aims to showcase the companies attracting significant investment funding.
- Subscribers can access charts, graphics, and visuals from the article for a monthly fee, highlighting the value of investment in Israel’s tech market.

items.title: Tesla secures key approval to run robotaxi service in California
items.summary:
- Tesla has received its first approval from California regulators for its robotaxi service.
- The California Public Utilities Commission granted a transportation charter-party carrier permit for employee transport.
- This permit does not include ride-hailing or autonomous vehicle services, which require separate approvals.
- Tesla has not yet applied for additional permits necessary for a full robotaxi service.

items.title: Taiwan fines Singapore’s fintech firm over China ties
items.summary:
- Taiwan's regulatory authority imposed fines on a Singapore-based fintech company for its connections to China.
- The fines are part of Taiwan's efforts to enforce regulations concerning foreign investments linked to China.
- The name of the fintech firm and the amount of the fines were not specified in the report.

items.title: Didi’s Q4 revenue rises 7.1% but posts $179m net loss
items.summary:
- Didi reported a 7.1% increase in Q4 revenue.
- The company faced a net loss of $179 million in the same quarter.
- These results indicate ongoing financial challenges despite revenue growth.

items.title: Japan’s Metaplanet invests $12.5m worth of bitcoin
items.summary:
- Metaplanet, a Tokyo-listed investment firm, acquired 150 bitcoin for approximately $12.5 million at an average price of $83,508 per BTC.
- Total holdings now stand at 3,200 BTC, valued at approximately $265.9 million based on current prices.
- To fund further purchases, Metaplanet raised 2 billion yen ($13.3 million) through a bond issuance on the same day.
- The firm aims to hold 10,000 BTC by the end of 2025 and 21,000 BTC by 2026, having adopted a bitcoin-focused strategy in April 2024.

items.title: Japanese IT firm NTT Data invests $500m in India for AI expansion
items.summary:
- NTT Data to invest $500 million in India within 12 to 18 months.
- Focus on expanding data center operations and enhancing AI capabilities.
- Currently operates 16 data centers in India with 290 MW capacity, plans to add 210 MW in 2-3 years.
- Investment will support sovereign cloud solutions for the financial sector.
- Upgrading Bengaluru Innovation Centre for AI, digital twin technology, and quantum computing.
- Total investment in India since 2007 exceeds $3 billion.

items.title: Apple loses appeal in Germany, faces stricter market rules
items.summary:
- Apple lost an appeal against a German regulatory decision leading to stricter market controls.
- The ruling was issued by the Federal Court of Justice in Karlsruhe on Mar. 18.
- The court upheld a 2023 classification of Apple by the German cartel office as a company with significant cross-market influence, similar to Google and Meta.
- Apple's request to involve the European Court of Justice was denied, reinforcing German regulations on tech giants.
- The ruling increases scrutiny of Apple's App Store due to concerns regarding user data collection.

items.title: GoTo denies rumors of Grab acquisition talks in Indonesia
items.summary:
- GoTo Gojek announced on Mar. 19 it has not agreed to any acquisition talks with Grab.
- This follows a report suggesting Grab was progressing in acquisition plans, causing Grab's shares to rise by 5.4% during premarket on Mar. 18.
- GoTo's shares also increased by 5% on the same day, following reports of intermittent merger discussions between both firms.

items.title: US-based Web3 firm Halliday nets $20m series A
items.summary:
- Halliday, a San Francisco-based web3 workflow protocol developer, raised US$20 million in a series A funding round led by a16z crypto.
- Other participants included Avalanche Blizzard Fund, Credibly Neutral, Alt Layer, and angel investors.
- Total capital raised by Halliday since its founding in April 2022 is now US$26 million.
- The funds will be used to expand the 17-person team and develop Halliday's workflow protocol and payments application, Halliday Payments.
- CEO Griffin Dunaif emphasized the goal of helping developers build blockchain applications more efficiently and the integration of AI systems within decentralized networks.

items.title: Venturi Partners launches $225m second fund for consumer brands
items.summary:
- Venturi Partners has launched a $225 million second fund targeting consumer brands.
- The fund aims to invest in high-quality consumer brands across various sectors.
- This initiative marks a significant step for Venturi Partners in expanding their investment portfolio.

items.title: Indian beauty brand Pilgrim bags $23m
items.author: Anurag Kedia, Gagandeep Makker
items.summary:
- Mumbai-based beauty brand Pilgrim raises $23 million (200 crore rupee) in funding.
- The company is valued at 3,000 crore rupee (approximately $346 million).
- Investors include Narotam Sekhsaria Family Office, Vertex Ventures SEAI, and new investors like Vertex Growth Fund.
- Funds will be used for offline expansion, R&D enhancement, and maintaining profitability online.
- Pilgrim was founded in 2019, offers sulphate and paraben-free products, and sells via multiple channels.

items.title: Israeli auto firm signs licensing deal worth up to $770m
items.summary:
- Ree Automotive announced a preliminary licensing agreement potentially worth up to $770 million by 2030.
- The deal involves an undisclosed mobility solutions company and is expected to be finalized soon.
- Ree will license its platform for self-driving vehicles, with production starting in 2027 and software revenue expected in the second half of this year.
- The company aims to enhance margins and profitability through its focus on software-defined vehicles instead of traditional manufacturing.
- The agreement could increase Ree's order backlog from $150 million to nearly $1 billion.
- CEO Daniel Barel emphasized the scaling production benefits.

items.title: Indian VC firm Gruhas, Brigade Group to launch $35m fund
items.author: Nikhil Kamath
items.summary:
- Gruhas partners with Brigade Group to launch a new fund focused on proptech and sustainability.
- The Earth Fund is worth 300 crore rupees (US$34.6 million) and is created under Zoiros Projects Private Limited.
- It includes a 200 crore rupees (US$23 million) SEBI-registered fund and a 100 crore rupees (US$11.5 million) green-shoe option.
- The fund will support 10-15 startups in real estate tech, construction tech, clean tech, and climate tech, with investments of US$1-2 million.
- Funded startups will receive mentorship from Brigade Group, which has previously supported over 80 startups through its REAP accelerator.

items.title: Ex-Indian fintech unicorn execs start asset management venture
items.summary:
- Ex-Indian fintech unicorn executives have launched a new asset management venture.
- The venture aims to optimize investment strategies through advanced technology and finance expertise.
- It focuses on providing innovative financial solutions to clients in the ever-evolving market.
